The synthesis temperature seems to have minor impact on the formation of phase‐pure products, but at temperatures far below the optimum of 200 °C, a drastically shrinking of the average crystal size was observed. Cooling rates of −5 K/h and reaction times of at least 2 d provided single‐crystals of
K larger than 0.4 mm (Figure 2), although completely crystalline products can be received with holding times lower than 10 h. Significantly larger platelets of
K (>1 mm edge length) were found in reactions with lower base concentration, where, however,K 2−x[Fe 4O 7−x(OH) x] is the main product (see above).
